intro: Canarina laevigata, commonly known as the smooth canarywood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually simple, opposite, and have a smooth texture, giving it its common name. Canarina laevigata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
